alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland; Coastal Waldo; Coastal York; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued April 18 at 4:41PM EDT until April 19 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 4 PM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding, splash-over, and beach erosion due to high astronomical tides, storm surge, and increasing waves. * WHERE...Coastal York, Coastal Cumberland, Sagadahoc, Lincoln, Knox and Coastal Waldo Counties. * WHEN...From noon to 4 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Portland ME MLLW Categories - Minor 12.0 ft, Moderate 13.0 ft, Major 14.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.3 ft, Moderate 3.3 ft, Major 4.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 19/01 AM 11.4 1.7 0.3 2-4 None 19/02 PM 11.2 1.5 1.3 10-11 Minor 20/02 AM 11.2 1.5 0.2 6-7 None 20/03 PM 9.0 -0.7 -0.6 5-7 None 21/03 AM 10.2 0.5 -0.6 4 None Boothbay Harbor ME MLLW Categories - Minor 13.0 ft, Moderate 14.0 ft, Major 15.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 3.3 ft, Moderate 4.3 ft, Major 5.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 19/01 AM 11.1 1.4 0.3 2-3 None 19/01 PM 11.1 1.4 1.8 10-12 Minor 20/02 AM 11.1 1.4 0.4 7 None 20/03 PM 8.8 -0.9 -0.5 3-4 None 21/03 AM 9.9 0.2 -0.5 2 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
